page.title: 17QUARRYING METHODS,TEST VLY
page.content: a backactor.The gravel is dug from pits about 6m deep.Many of the empty hollows are now filled with water.They dig out 200 000 tons in 3 months which is about 1 600 tons a day.The gravel is loaded onto lorries owned by the buyer.There are 6 people employed at the quarry. When a pit is finished they push back the waste material and the land is levelled out.The top soil is replaced and the land is turned into grazing for cows.It can never be used for building. Some of the gravel produced here is used on the estate for reinforcing tracks and drains.The rest is sold to a main buyer who uses it for road working and foundations of buildings.
